## run this to automate the generation of the result files. Just modify the make up for the species once.

```{r}

render_model = function(species_p1, species_p2, species_p3, species_p4, species_p5) {
  rmarkdown::render(
    input = "C:/Users/kll86/OneDrive/Documents/UCSB/quotabasket_model/working_model/auto_model_defaults_price.Rmd", # What's the input file to render?
    params = list(species_p1=species_p1, species_p2=species_p2, species_p3=species_p3, species_p4=species_p4, species_p5=species_p5), # What are the parameters?
    output_file = paste0("runs_", species_p1, species_p2, species_p3, species_p4, species_p5, "_mix .html") # What should I name the output file?
  )
}

species_p1 = 1
species_p2 = 10
species_p3 = 20
species_p4 = 30
species_p5 = 40

species_p <- as.vector(c(species_p1, species_p2, species_p3, species_p4, species_p5))

possible_scenarios <- permutations(n=5,r=5,species_p,set=FALSE)

 for (i in 1:nrow(possible_scenarios)){
   
   render_model(possible_scenarios[i,1], possible_scenarios[i,2], possible_scenarios[i,3], possible_scenarios[i,4], possible_scenarios[i,5])
   
}

```
